trans-unit.source: Trains a classification or regression model in a supervised manner
trans-unit.target: Trains a classification or regression model in a supervised manner

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Train Model</ui> module to train a classification or regression model.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Train Model</ui> module to train a classification or regression model.

trans-unit.source: Training a classification or regression model is a kind of <newTerm>supervised machine learning</newTerm>.
trans-unit.target: Training a classification or regression model is a kind of <newTerm>supervised machine learning</newTerm>.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, you must provide a dataset that contains historical data from which to learn patterns.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, you must provide a dataset that contains historical data from which to learn patterns.

trans-unit.source: The machine learning model uses the data to extract statistical patterns and build a model.
trans-unit.target: The machine learning model uses the data to extract statistical patterns and build a model.

trans-unit.source: When you configure <ui>Train Model</ui>, you must provide as inputs the model to use, and the column in the training dataset that contains the label or the response variable.
trans-unit.target: When you configure <ui>Train Model</ui>, you must provide as inputs the model to use, and the column in the training dataset that contains the label or the response variable.

trans-unit.source: The <newTerm>label</newTerm> column contains the known values for the class or outcome you want to predict.
trans-unit.target: The <newTerm>label</newTerm> column contains the known values for the class or outcome you want to predict.

trans-unit.source: For classification problems, the label column must contain categorical values or discrete values.
trans-unit.target: For classification problems, the label column must contain categorical values or discrete values.

trans-unit.source: Some examples might be: a yes/no rating, a disease classification code or name, or an income group.
trans-unit.target: Some examples might be: a yes/no rating, a disease classification code or name, or an income group.

trans-unit.source: For regression problems, the label column contains the response variable, which must be a numeric data type.
trans-unit.target: For regression problems, the label column contains the response variable, which must be a numeric data type.

trans-unit.source: Some examples might be: a credit risk score, the projected time to failure for a hard drive, or the forecasted number of calls to a call center on a given day or time.
trans-unit.target: Some examples might be: a credit risk score, the projected time to failure for a hard drive, or the forecasted number of calls to a call center on a given day or time.

trans-unit.source: After the model has been trained by processing all the data, the output is a trained classification or regression model.
trans-unit.target: After the model has been trained by processing all the data, the output is a trained classification or regression model.

trans-unit.source: You can pass the model to the <link xlink:href="401b4f92-e724-4d5a-be81-d5b0ff9bdb33" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Score Model</link> module to do predictions on new datasets.
trans-unit.target: You can pass the model to the <link xlink:href="401b4f92-e724-4d5a-be81-d5b0ff9bdb33" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Score Model</link> module to do predictions on new datasets.

trans-unit.source: If you do not specify which label column to use, Azure Machine Learning will try to infer which is the appropriate label column, by using the metadata of the dataset.
trans-unit.target: If you do not specify which label column to use, Azure Machine Learning will try to infer which is the appropriate label column, by using the metadata of the dataset.

trans-unit.source: You can always correct this selection by specifying a new column, either by name or by the column index.
trans-unit.target: You can always correct this selection by specifying a new column, either by name or by the column index.

trans-unit.source: For examples of how the <ui>Train Model</ui> module is used in machine learning experiments, see these experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: For examples of how the <ui>Train Model</ui> module is used in machine learning experiments, see these experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Retail Forecasting</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525950</linkUri></externalLink> sample demonstrates how to build, train, and compare multiple models.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Retail Forecasting</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525950</linkUri></externalLink> sample demonstrates how to build, train, and compare multiple models.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Flight Delay Prediction</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525725</linkUri></externalLink> sample demonstrates how to train multiple related classification models.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Flight Delay Prediction</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525725</linkUri></externalLink> sample demonstrates how to train multiple related classification models.

trans-unit.source: Select the column that contains the label or outcome column
trans-unit.target: Select the column that contains the label or outcome column

trans-unit.source: For a list of all module errors, see <link xlink:href="60822377-da7a-40b8-aec7-d185d1509344" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For a list of all module errors, see <link xlink:href="60822377-da7a-40b8-aec7-d185d1509344" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if argument is not a number.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if argument is not a number.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if argument is Infinity.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if argument is Infinity.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if dataset used for training cannot be used for concrete type of learner.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if dataset used for training cannot be used for concrete type of learner.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if no features were provided for a given user or item.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if no features were provided for a given user or item.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if number of columns in some of the datasets passed to the module is too small.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if number of columns in some of the datasets passed to the module is too small.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if number of rows in some of the datasets passed to the module is too small.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if number of rows in some of the datasets passed to the module is too small.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if passed to module learner has invalid type.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if passed to module learner has invalid type.
